description: Specify which side(s) of facets are active. An inactive side will allow balls or pebbles to pass through it without being repelled. Both sides of all facets are active by default. The range is applied to facets. Use the set range element to filter by walls. One can visualize the normal vector with the wall arrow plot to assess the orientations of facet normals. Note: No effort is made to mitigate large forces that develop when balls or pebbles migrate from the inactive to active sides of walls. Thus large velocities may result in these situations.

keywords.name: bottom
keywords.description: Set the side opposite the direction of the facet normal vector as active

keywords.name: neither
keywords.description: Set both sides as inactive. No forces will occur

keywords.name: top
keywords.description: Set the side in the direction of the facet normal vector as active

examples.description: Set both sides of all facets as active (default behavior)
Set only the top side (normal direction) active for facets with IDs 1-10
Set the bottom side (opposite to normal direction) active for all facets
Deactivate both sides for facets in group 'boundary' - no forces will occur

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: Facet.set_active(code) - codes: 0=both, 1=top (normal dir), -1=bottom, 2=neither. Requires iteration over facets
